Metadata.title: FitWith — Your Personal Fitness Coach
Metadata.description: Personalized training and nutrition plans from certified fitness coach Aleksandar Stojanović. Online mentoring, individual approach, proven results.

Hero.title: YOUR PERSONAL FITNESS COACH
Hero.subtitle: Personalized training and nutrition plans tailored to your goals. Expert guidance, constant support, and proven results.

Services.title: How I can help you
Services.subtitle: Choose the package that fits your goals and budget
Services.tier1Desc: Complete guidance — training plan, nutrition plan, progress tracking, access to exercise library and constant support via messages.
Services.tier2Desc: Individually designed training plan adapted to your goals, equipment, and available time.
Services.tier3Desc: Customized nutrition plan based on your goals, preferences, and health condition.

TransformationsPage.title: Transformations
TransformationsPage.subtitle: See the results of clients who changed their lives with the FitWith program. Every transformation is a story of dedication, hard work, and the right guidance.
TransformationsPage.ctaText: Join clients who have already achieved their goals.
TransformationsPage.transformation1Quote: With FitWith I lost 13kg in 12 weeks, while feeling stronger than ever. Aleksandar was with me every step of the way.
TransformationsPage.transformation2Quote: I didn't believe I could achieve such results. The personalized approach to nutrition and training made a huge difference.
TransformationsPage.transformation3Quote: I gained 10kg of lean muscle mass in 20 weeks. The plan was perfectly tailored to my schedule and goals.
TransformationsPage.transformation4Quote: I finally found an approach that works. -12kg in 10 weeks, no starvation, with healthy habits I maintain to this day.

Pricing.title: Pricing
Pricing.subtitle: Choose the plan that fits your goals
Pricing.faq1Q: What does the collaboration process look like?
Pricing.faq1A: After payment, you fill out an initial questionnaire with detailed information about your goals, experience, and preferences. Based on that, I create a personalized plan within 48 hours.
Pricing.faq2A: Of course! You can upgrade your package or change the type of collaboration at any time. The price difference is calculated proportionally.
Pricing.faq3A: Each plan is designed for a one-month period, with the option to extend and adjust based on your progress.
Pricing.faq4A: The training plan is adapted to your available equipment — whether you train in a gym, at home, or outdoors.

WhyChoose.title: Why FitWith?
WhyChoose.subtitle: Everything you need for a successful transformation
WhyChoose.benefit1Desc: Every plan is created exclusively for you, based on your goals, experience, and capabilities.
WhyChoose.benefit2Desc: Direct communication with the coach via messages. Answer to all your questions within 24 hours.
WhyChoose.benefit3Desc: Access to a video library with detailed demonstrations of all exercises from your plan.
WhyChoose.benefit4Desc: Over 100 satisfied clients and visible transformations on average after just 8 weeks.

Cta.title: Ready for a change?
Cta.subtitle: Take the first step towards your goal. Contact me and schedule a free consultation.

About.title: About
About.bio1: I was born in 1998 in Belgrade. I graduated from the Faculty of Sport and Physical Education (DIF) in Belgrade, where I gained thorough knowledge in training, physiology, and sports science.
About.bio2: I further refined my expertise under Dušan Petrović, one of the most respected fitness and conditioning training specialists in Serbia. This education enabled me to develop a comprehensive approach to training and nutrition.
About.bio3: With over 4 years of experience working with clients, I specialize in creating personalized training and nutrition plans that deliver measurable results. My approach is science-based, individually adapted, and focused on long-term lifestyle changes.
About.philosophyText: I believe there is no universal approach to fitness. Every client is unique — with their own goals, limitations, and lifestyle. My job is to create a plan that fits into your life, not the other way around. The focus is not just on short-term results, but on building healthy habits that last.
About.cert3: Continuous education in nutrition and training

ServicesPage.title: Services
ServicesPage.subtitle: Choose the collaboration model that suits you best
ServicesPage.tier1Desc: Online mentoring is the most popular collaboration model that includes everything you need for a successful transformation. You get a personalized training and nutrition plan, regular progress tracking, access to the complete exercise library with video demonstrations, and constant support via direct messages.
tier1Features: Access to exercise library with videos
ServicesPage.tier2Desc: If you only need a training plan, this is the right choice. Based on your goals, available equipment, and time, I create a detailed training plan with progression, periodization, and video demonstrations of all exercises.
tier2Features: Adapted to your equipment and conditions
ServicesPage.tier3Desc: A personalized nutrition plan created according to your goals, food preferences, allergies, and health condition. You'll receive a complete meal schedule with a grocery list and preparation instructions.
ServicesPage.ctaTitle: Not sure which package to choose?
ServicesPage.ctaText: Contact me and I'll help you choose the right collaboration model for your goals.

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.subtitle: Have a question? Feel free to reach out.
Contact.successText: Thank you for your message. I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
Contact.errorText: An error occurred. Please try again or contact me directly.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: Your privacy is very important to us. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal data.
Privacy.section1Text: We collect data that you voluntarily provide through the contact form, questionnaire, or registration: full name, email address, phone number, health and goal information (via questionnaire), before/after transformation photos (with your consent).
Privacy.section2Text: We use your data exclusively for: creating personalized training and nutrition plans, communicating regarding your program, improving our services, sending relevant information (with your consent).
Privacy.section3Text: We take technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse. Your data is stored on secure servers with encryption.
Privacy.section4Text: You have the right to: request access to your data, request correction or deletion of data, withdraw consent for data processing, file a complaint with the competent authority.
Privacy.section5Text: For all privacy-related questions, contact us at info@onlinetrener.rs.

Exercises.label: Exercise Library
Exercises.title: Exercises
Exercises.subtitle: Browse the complete exercise library with detailed instructions and video demonstrations.
Exercises.ctaSubtitle: Every exercise in your plan will be tailored to your goals and capabilities.
Exercises.benchPressDesc: A fundamental exercise for developing the chest muscles. Performed on a flat bench with a barbell or dumbbells. Excellent for building upper body strength and mass.
benchPressInstructions: Lie on a flat bench with feet firmly on the floor. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Unrack the bar and lower it in a controlled manner to the middle of your chest, elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Press the bar upward to full arm extension, exhaling as you push.
Hold briefly at the top and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Exercises.latPulldownDesc: A back exercise performed on a cable machine. Ideal for developing back width and strengthening the upper body.
latPulldownInstructions: Sit at the machine with knees secured under the pads. Grip the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull the bar down toward the top of your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Hold the contraction for a second at the bottom position.
Return the bar to the starting position in a controlled manner, feeling the stretch in your lats.
Exercises.squatDesc: A fundamental exercise for legs and glutes. Engages a large number of muscle groups and stimulates strength and muscle growth throughout the entire body.
squatInstructions: Place the bar on your upper traps, feet shoulder-width apart or slightly wider.
Inhale, brace your core, and begin descending by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor or deeper, depending on mobility.
Drive up through your heels to the starting position, exhaling at the top of the movement.
Exercises.overheadPressDesc: A shoulder development exercise performed standing or seated. Builds strength and stability of the entire shoulder girdle.
overheadPressInstructions: Stand upright, feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
Brace your core and press the bar vertically upward, tilting your head slightly to let the bar pass.
Extend your arms fully at the top, bar directly overhead.
Lower the bar back to shoulder height in a controlled manner and repeat.
Exercises.bicepCurlDesc: An isolation exercise for the biceps performed with dumbbells or a barbell. Effective for targeted development of the upper arm muscles.
bicepCurlInstructions: Stand upright, hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward.
Bend your elbows and curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
At the top of the movement, squeeze the biceps for a second.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner without swinging your body.
Exercises.plankDesc: An isometric core stabilization exercise. Strengthens deep abdominal, back, and hip muscles. A foundation of every good training routine.
plankInstructions: Get into a push-up position but rest on your forearms instead of your hands.
Your body should form a straight line from head to heels — don't raise or drop your hips.
Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and keep your shoulders above your elbows.
Hold the position for the desired time, breathing evenly.
Exercises.bandPullApartDesc: A corrective exercise with a resistance band for strengthening the rear shoulder and upper back. Great for improving posture and preventing injuries.
bandPullApartInstructions: Stand upright, hold a resistance band in front of you at shoulder width, arms extended.
Pull the band apart by moving your hands away from each other, squeezing your shoulder blades.
Hold the end position for 1-2 seconds, feeling the contraction in your rear delts and rhomboids.
Return your hands to the starting position in a controlled manner and repeat.
Exercises.muscleUpDesc: An advanced calisthenics exercise combining a pull-up and dip in one movement. Requires a high level of upper body strength and coordination.
muscleUpInstructions: Grip the pull-up bar with a false grip (wrists over the bar), hands slightly wider than shoulder width.
Perform a kip swing and explosively pull yourself upward, driving your chest toward the bar.
When your chest reaches bar level, quickly transition your wrists over the bar into a dip position.
Extend your arms fully at the top, then lower yourself back to a dead hang in a controlled manner.

Blog.title: Blog
Blog.subtitle: Tips, knowledge, and inspiration for your fitness journey. Articles about training, nutrition, recovery, and motivation.
Blog.noResults: No articles found for this search.
Blog.author: Author
Blog.post1Title: How to Start Working Out: A Complete Beginner's Guide
Blog.post1Excerpt: Everything you need to know before your first gym visit — from choosing a program to proper form and progression.
Blog.post1Content1: Starting to work out can be intimidating, especially if you've never been to a gym before. A good plan, realistic expectations, and understanding basic training principles are the keys to success. In this article, I'll walk you through everything you need to know.
Blog.post1Content2:
## Choosing a Program

The most important thing for beginners is consistency, not a perfect program. I recommend full body training 3 times per week, focusing on compound movements: squat, deadlift, bench press, rowing, and overhead press. These exercises engage the most muscle groups and give the best results for time invested.
Blog.post1Content3:
## Progressive Overload

The key to progress is gradually increasing the load. Start with weights you can control with proper form. Every week, try to add a little weight or reps. This principle, known as progressive overload, is the foundation of every successful program.
Blog.post1Content4:
## Recovery and Nutrition

Training is just the stimulus — growth happens during recovery. Sleep at least 7-8 hours, consume enough protein (1.6-2.2g/kg body weight), and stay hydrated. Without proper recovery, even the best program won't deliver results.
Blog.post2Title: Protein: The Complete Guide — How Much, When, and Which
Blog.post2Excerpt: Everything about protein — daily needs, timing, sources, and whether you really need a supplement.
Blog.post2Content1: Protein is the foundation of muscle building and recovery. Whether your goal is hypertrophy, fat loss, or improving athletic performance, adequate protein intake is crucial. But how much is really enough?
Blog.post2Content2:
## Daily Needs

For active individuals who weight train, the optimal intake is 1.6-2.2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight per day. An 80kg person needs to consume 128-176g of protein daily. This sounds like a lot, but with good meal planning it's entirely achievable.
Blog.post2Content3:
## Protein Timing

The myth of the 30-minute "anabolic window" after training is largely outdated. Much more important is the total daily intake and even distribution of protein across meals. Aim for 30-50g of protein per meal, spread across 3-5 meals per day.
Blog.post2Content4:
## Food vs. Supplements

It's always better to prioritize protein from food: chicken, fish, eggs, dairy products, legumes. Whey protein is useful as a supplement when it's hard to reach daily intake through food alone, but it's not necessary. A quality nutrition plan can cover all your needs.
Blog.post3Title: Why Sleep Is Key to Fitness Results
Blog.post3Excerpt: How quality sleep directly affects muscle growth, fat loss, and athletic performance.
Blog.post3Content1: Sleep is one of the most neglected factors in fitness. During deep sleep, the body secretes growth hormone, repairs muscle fibers, and consolidates motor patterns learned during training. Cutting sleep can undo all the effort put in at the gym.
Blog.post3Content2:
## Impact on Hormones

Studies show that just one week of restricted sleep (5-6 hours) can reduce testosterone levels by 10-15% and increase cortisol levels. This directly affects the ability to build muscle and lose fat. The goal is 7-9 hours of quality sleep every night.
Blog.post3Content3:
## Practical Tips

Stick to a consistent sleep schedule. Avoid screens 1 hour before bed. Keep the room dark and cool (18-20°C). Avoid caffeine after 2pm. These simple changes can drastically improve sleep quality and thus your fitness results.
Blog.post4Title: How to Lose Fat Without Losing Muscle
Blog.post4Excerpt: Strategies for effective fat loss while preserving hard-earned muscle mass.
Blog.post4Content1: One of the biggest challenges in fitness is losing body fat without losing muscle. Too aggressive a calorie deficit, insufficient protein intake, and neglecting strength training are the most common mistakes that lead to muscle loss during a diet.
Blog.post4Content2:
## Moderate Calorie Deficit

The optimal deficit is 300-500 calories per day, resulting in a loss of 0.5-1kg per week. More aggressive deficits (1000+ calories) often lead to muscle loss, reduced metabolism, and increased risk of the "yo-yo" effect. Patience is key.
Blog.post4Content3:
## Strength Training Is Mandatory

During a deficit, strength training sends the body a signal that muscles are needed and shouldn't be used as an energy source. Maintain training intensity (weight on the bar), but reduce total volume by 20-30% if needed. Never switch to a cardio-only program.
Blog.post4Content4:
## High Protein Intake

During a deficit phase, protein needs are higher than during maintenance or bulking. I recommend 2.0-2.4g/kg body weight. Protein helps preserve muscle, reduces hunger, and has a high thermic effect (the body uses energy to digest it).

Questionnaire.title: Initial Questionnaire
Questionnaire.subtitle: Fill out the questionnaire so I can create the best possible training and nutrition plan for you.
Questionnaire.intro: First of all, I want to thank you for choosing me as your mentor. I want you to know that I will do my best to make our collaboration successful, but first, I need you to answer a few questions. Take your time and be completely honest so I can create the best possible plan for you.
Questionnaire.successText: Thank you for completing the questionnaire. Your personalized plan will be ready within 48 hours.
Questionnaire.errorText: An error occurred. Please try again or contact me directly.
Questionnaire.fitnessGoalPlaceholder: e.g. Fat loss, muscle gain, improved endurance...
